page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY 1925
page.content: The Domesday Book said of the area.'It is a waste'.In 1925 {people lived} under the conditions of the 1914-18 War.There was a {Cotton Spinning and {Dubbing Yarn Factory.}Workers walked, cycled or in the valley used the first{mot0r}bus.Consumer goods deficiences had been made up and the mills went on {short time}.Average wage was Â£2-2.50 and the dole Â£1.25.Most of the{farmers}kept beef cattle,pigs and chickens and sold milk and butter locally.The{main fuel}was coal.Paraffin and candles were used for{lighting}and gas if you lived at the road side.Tapers wereused around the house.All used tub toilets.Coal was brought by horse and cart from Mytholmroyd.
